alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 11:43PM PDT until April 07 at 8:59PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .Heavy rain over the south slopes of the Olympics into early Friday morning will cause the Skokomish River near Potlatch to go above flood stage. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skokomish River at Potlatch. * WHEN...From late tonight to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause widespread flooding of pasture lands, with water flowing quickly over West Bourgault Road and Skokomish Valley Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 PM PDT Thursday the stage was 16.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 16.7 feet around 5 AM Friday. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by 700 AM.Friday morning at 745 AM PDT.
